messages.subject: Re:Silent Running
messages.msgSnippet: From: Shyrley  ... been deeply affected :-( ... broken :-( That movie really affected me when I saw it in junior high. Recently
messages.messageBody:
From: Shyrley <shyrley.williams@...>
>We just watched the movie Silent Running. It's so sad. My two boys have
been deeply affected :-(
>
>That man could have left Huey to keep Duey company even if he was a bit
broken :-(

That movie really affected me when I saw it in junior high. Recently watched
it with my kids and they were sad about it for days. They really felt for
the little robot guy. It's also amazing to see how far Sci Fi movies have
come in just a generation.

Blue Skies!
-Robin-

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Silent Running
messages.msgSnippet: I watched the DVD - it s like an unschooling-production.  The studio gave the director 100% freedom!  Classic!  So was Am. Graffiti!! Tim Thomas ... From:
messages.messageBody:
I watched the DVD - it's like an unschooling-production. The studio gave the director 100% freedom! Classic! So was Am. Graffiti!!

Tim Thomas
----- Original Message -----
From: Shyrley
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 20, 2003 8:16 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Silent Running




We just watched the movie Silent Running. It's so sad. My two boys have been deeply affected :-(

That man could have left Huey to keep Duey company even if he was a bit broken :-(

Shyrley with tissues
